result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin J Zynda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime
PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin J Zynda

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Justin J Zynda in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:46 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Amended Information filed for Count 1 to a misdemeanor.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - Guilty
Count 2 - Guilty 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on both Count 1 & 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay Jail sentence of 120 days on Count 1 and 30 days on Count 2 to run concurrent to each other
Placed on Probation for 24 months
3 days conditional jail
50 hours of Community Service
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.  
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Pay fine of $100 plus costs 

Count 2 -
Impose/Stay Jail sentence of 120 days on Count 1 and 30 days on Count 2 to run concurrent to each other
Placed on Probation for 24 months concurrent to Count 1
Pay costs 
Comply with conditions in Count 1

Defendant Justin J Zynda in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:01 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

BY THE COURT:
NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.
Case to be Pre-Tried today and report to be filed with the Court.
Bond Continued.

Defendant Justin J Zynda not in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Cousins indicates the defense attorney filed a written waiver.  He has filed the information.  Asks to set the matter for arraignment on 8/17/15.  Arraignment scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

Defendant Justin J Zynda in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
